A minivan is a vehicle designed primarily for passengers, with two or three rows of seating and a large cargo area.
A minivan is a vehicle that has a small size.
A minivan is a vehicle that has three rows of seats and is used to transport people.
A minivan is a vehicle designed primarily for passengers, with two or three rows of seating.
The mini van is a Toyota Sienna.
A minivan, or simply van, is a vehicle designed primarily for passengers, with two or three rows of seating accessed via large doors.
A minivan is a vehicle designed primarily for passengers, with two or three rows of seating accessed via large doors.
A minivan is a vehicle designed primarily for passengers, with two or three rows of seating accessed via large sliding doors.
Mini vans are a type of vehicle.
A minivan is a vehicle that is designed to carry more than one person.
The mini van is a Honda Odyssey.
A minivan or MPV is a vehicle size classification describing a high-roof vehicle with a flexible interior layout.
A minivan, or MPV (multi-purpose vehicle), is a vehicle size class which is larger than a compact car but smaller than a full-size van.
The mini van is a Dodge Grand Caravan.
A minivan, multi-purpose vehicle (MPV), or multi-utility vehicle (MUV) is a vehicle size classification describing a high-roof vehicle with a flexible interior layout.
A minivan, multi-purpose vehicle (MPV), or multi-utility vehicle (MUV) is a vehicle size class designed to provide passengers with enhanced passenger capacity and cargo capacity.

The Honda Odyssey is a minivan manufactured and marketed by Japanese automaker Honda since 1994, now in its fifth generation. The Odyssey had originally been conceived and engineered in Japan, in the wake of the country's economic crisis of the 1990s – which in turn imposed severe constraints on the vehicle's size and overall concept, dictating the minivan's manufacture in an existing facility with minimal modification. The result was a smaller minivan, in the compact MPV class – which was in sharp contrast to the larger American offerings, in the traditional minivan size segment.

A van is a type of road vehicle used for transporting goods or people. Depending on the type of van, it can be bigger or smaller than a truck and SUV, and bigger than a common car. There is some varying in the scope of the word across the different English-speaking countries.

The Dodge Caravan is a minivan manufactured and marketed by Chrysler. Introduced for model year 1984 and now in its fifth generation, the Caravan has been offered in short-wheelbase and long-wheelbase variants.
The Ford Aerostar is a minivan that was manufactured and marketed by Ford from 1985 to 1997.
The Caravan is a minivan produced by Chrysler Group LLC for its Dodge brand.
The Ford Transit Connect is a compact panel van developed by Ford Europe and derived from the Ford Focus.
The Toyota Sienna is a minivan manufactured by Toyota at the Toyota Motor Manufacturing Indiana facility in Princeton, Indiana, United States, for the North American market.
The Chrysler Town & Country is a luxury passenger minivan that was manufactured and marketed by Chrysler. It was introduced in 1989 for the 1990 model year.
The Ford Transit is a range of light commercial vehicles produced by Ford.
It is a Toyota Sienna.
